Author: comex
Content: Interesting.  The actual paper claims that "there are no known cases of an adult successfully" acquiring absolute pitch, although following the reference chain leads me to a partial Google Books result which seems to claim that someone did.  I wonder what thresholds are being used.

Author: TillE
Content: It depends on the type of game obviously (anything that works like a board game should be fine), but I've had a lot of difficulty despite my best attempts at avoiding floats. For example, how do you calculate even a straight line between two points on a grid using only integers? At some point you just wind up reinventing some form of decimal arithmetic.

Author: sigzero
Content: Let the Python wars begin. Which is sad, because unless there is a fork (which would be the worse thing to happen) the 2.7 branch is a dead end. Python 3 is the way forward and the community should rally behind that.

Author: cskau
Title: Inside PDF / Text Content in PDF Files [2008]

Author: michielvoo
Content: The more I read about Python 2/3, the more I feel PEP 404 ("there is no official Python 2.8 release") will become an anachronism, and that a Python 2.8 will probably happen as a fork. It might not be official, but it may become de facto.

Author: oneeyedpigeon
Content: Also, tools like Photoshop and Word become the de facto 'standard' because of piracy.

Author: userbinator
Content: AFAIK RD9700 is not an ASIX clone but a Davicom DM9601 clone. The DM9601 is a full speed device. If anything the one in the OP is an RD6877 (ASIX clone) which is high speed.
